intro: Psychotria perijaensis, commonly known as the Perijan psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests. Psychotria perijaensis is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique foliage and floral display.
